importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The storm's eye is expected to pass near Catanduanes on Saturday, marking the critical period when evacuation orders were activated and residents fled to safety.

keyTakeAways: Thousands of residents in Catanduanes, a Philippine island, evacuated their homes ahead of Tropical Storm Fengshen due to predicted coastal flooding and high winds.
Fengshen is expected to bring heavy rainfall and waves up to 1.2 meters (3.2 feet), posing a 'minimal to moderate risk' of coastal flooding.
The evacuation of over 9,000 people reflects a recurring drill on Catanduanes, which is often the first landmass affected by western Pacific cyclones.
The Philippines faces an average of 20 storms and typhoons annually, primarily impacting impoverished, disaster-prone regions.
Scientists link increasing storm intensity to climate change, as global warming contributes to more powerful tropical storms.
The country is still recovering from recent major earthquakes and typhoons that caused significant loss of life and infrastructure damage.
A magnitude 6.9 earthquake in Cebu province earlier in the month killed at least 79 people.
A magnitude 7.4 earthquake off southern Philippines later in the month killed at least six, triggering tsunami warnings and a second quake.
Typhoon Ragasa in late September caused fatalities and forced thousands to evacuate from northern villages and schools.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Thousands of residents in Catanduanes, a Philippine island, evacuated their homes as Tropical Storm Fengshen approached, bringing heavy rainfall and a risk of coastal flooding from waves up to 1.2 meters. The evacuation, involving over 9,000 people, is part of a regular drill due to Catanduanes being the first landmass affected by western Pacific cyclones. The Philippines, which faces an average of 20 storms annually, is still recovering from recent disasters, including earthquakes and typhoons. Scientists warn that increasing storm intensity is linked to climate change, while the country's ongoing vulnerability to natural hazards underscores the need for resilient disaster response systems.
title: Thousands evacuate Philippine coast as Tropical Storm Fengshen approaches
